Description: Cup (?) or lower part of pottery jar (?); much decayed, very crumbly clay. Saite jar base.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

identification of object as E171 is not secure; the register card in Philadelphia describes E171 as a 'cup', while the Philadelphia register book describes it as an alabastron from the second temple of Apollo.
Compare Petrie 1906, pl. 36B, 16; id. 1923, pl. lix, type 24S; Aston 1999, 203, pl. 62, no. 1841.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.045)
